result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. April Sharisse Howell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant April Sharisse Howell appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for April Sharisse Howell.  Attorney Ryan Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is unavailable and requests an adjournment. Defense objects and moves to dismiss. Court grants the State's request for an adjournment. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Supervision Report 10-27-2022, filed.

Defendant April Sharisse Howell appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for April Sharisse Howell.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is not present and State requests an adjournment. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Supervision Report 09-30-2022, filed.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant April Sharisse Howell appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for April Sharisse Howell.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for State V Lee Hearing. Court advises parties that although today was calendared for a State V Lee Hearing, SPD office has appointed successor counsel. Court calendars the next court date for a Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Supervision Report 08-29-2022, filed.

Defendant April Sharisse Howell in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court orders matter adjourned for a State V Lee hearing in Branch 29.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Supervision Report 07-27-2022, filed.

Defendant April Sharisse Howell in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendent appears. Court vacates bench warrant. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the Preliminary Hearing. Court sets matter for Status of Counsel Hearing.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Conflict Information Letter; Filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant April Sharisse Howell not in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action as to bail.
Pretrial Supervision Report 07-01-2022, filed.

Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriffs

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No contact order signed and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Court MVP Bar and Grill

HEH (1/8/81)

Defendant April Sharisse Howell in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant April Sharisse Howell in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  April Sharisse Howell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
